skills.skill: Federal Financial Institutions Examination Council (FFIEC) guidance
Risk indicator trends in money laundering

duties_responsibilities.duty: Ensure compliance programs have appropriate policies, procedures, staffing, expertise, and tools to ramp capacity efficiently.
Understand and respond to changes in AML regulations and compliance requirements.
Assess AML customer risk and its impact on operational processes.
Collaborate with business partners to find compliance solutions with minimal customer friction.
Handle EDD and KYC escalation cases within specified SLAs.
Analyze large amounts of data to inform policy and process decisions.
Understand and mitigate risk indicator trends in money laundering and financial crime.
Stay updated on changes to federal and state AML laws and regulations.
Draft policies, procedures, and management reports.
Utilize Microsoft Office skills, including pivot tables, for AML work.
Work in a fast-paced, evolving, and time-critical environment.
Handle confidential and critical matters with integrity and discretion.
Understand larger picture while operating in a focused manner.
Collaborate with a team and exhibit a positive demeanor.
Demonstrate an entrepreneurial spirit, drive, accountability, and humility.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, or other relevant discipline.
Minimum of two years of project management and problem management processes.
Experience implementing best practices for AML process areas.
Certification such as Anti-Money Laundering Specialist, Financial Crimes Specialist, Certified Fraud Examiner, or related professional certification.
